lines.gurmukhi: drsnu dyiKE skl sMswru khY kvn diRsit sau mn drs smweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Darasanu Daykhiao Sakal Sansaaru Kahai , Kavan Drisati Sau Man Daras Samaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The whole world claims to have seen. But what is that marvellous sight which engrosses the mind in the looks of the Guru?

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys suinE suinE sB koaU khY kvn suriq suin Anq n DweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadays Souniao Souniao Sabh Kooo Kahai , Kavan Surati Souni Anat N Dhaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Everyone claims to have listened to the Guru's sermon. But what is that unique voice, hearing which the mind does not wander away?

lines.gurmukhi: jY jY kwr jpq jgq gurmMqR jIh kvn jugq joqI joiq ilv lweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jai Jai Kaar Japat Jagat Gurmantr Jeeha , Kavan Jougat Jotee Joti Liv Laaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The whole world praises the Guru's incantations and recite it too. But what is that mean which will attach the mind in the radiant Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: diRsit surq igAwn iDAwn srbMg hIn pqq pwvn gur mUV smJweIAY ]541]
lines.transliteration_english: Drisati Surat Giaan Dhiaan Sarabang Heena , Patat Paavan Gur Moorh Samajhaaeeai ?541?

Shabad OS B.translation: A fool who is devoid of such limbs and appendages that provide him with knowledge of the True Guru and contemplation, True Guru-the maker of pious people out of sinners, bless them with such divine knowledge through Naam Simran.  (541)
